page.title: 06Roads in the Longdon area
page.content:
The{M50, }Britain's first Motorway, was opened in 1964. It is a vital link to South Wales. It has recently been re-surfaced. It enters a cutting near Longdon and a service road -bridge was constructed to re-join two parts of a farm which it bisected. The {nearest exit} is {Junction 2}to{Ledbury. Longdon lies on the{B4211 Gloucester to {Upton-on-Severn }road and the S.W. of the area is crossed by the{A438 {Tewkesbury}to{Ledbury}road.
There is a{bus service}to{Tewkesbury on market days, i.e. Wednesdays and Saturdays. It links 7 villages leaving Longdon at 9.57 a.m. allowing 2 and a half hours for shopping and returning at 12.35. A {week-day works mini-bus}travels to Tewkesbury's Industrial Estate.
